quality_assessment: Excellent overview page with comprehensive MapReduce documentation. All previously identified issues have been addressed: cleanup failure handling, JSON log location for DLQ debugging, and concurrent resume protection are all properly documented.
positive_aspects: Clear explanation of the three phases (setup, map, reduce) with code examples
Excellent 'When to Use MapReduce' guidance with specific criteria
Performance sweet spot recommendation (10-1000 items, 10s-5min each)
Comprehensive work distribution features documented (filtering, sorting, pagination, deduplication)
Excellent visual Mermaid diagrams showing workflow and worktree isolation architecture
Strong example with copyright header updates demonstrating real-world usage
Good cross-references to related pages at the end
Helpful tip about testing with small subsets first
All internal links are valid and point to existing documentation files
Cleanup failure handling documented with worktree clean-orphaned command
DLQ items include json_log_location for debugging context (Spec 121)
Concurrent resume protection documented with lock management details (Spec 140)
Uses MkDocs Material features: admonitions (tip, note, warning, example), code annotations
Source references included in code examples
